document_data.name: Vianten
document_data.basicrefs: {{Cite organized play/LC/The Good, the Undead, and the Ugly|11}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Vianten''' was a [[human]] [[Cormyte]] stonecutter who worked in the town of [[Mossbridges]] in [[the Vast]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Possessions: Vianten was a talented stonecutter who carved quality statuettes, such as a rose-colored [[marble]] [[eagle]] or a black marble [[mammoth]]. Vianten was ready to sell his art for fifty [[gold]] [[coin]]s per piece. He also could carve a statuette for order, but the labor usually took him around three months.
document_data.Relationships:
Vianten was friends was [[Rodenostro]], a fellow Cormyte stonecutter. Both men were friendly towards anyone interested in their craft, especially [[dwarves]].

Rodenostro and Vianten were acquainted with the retired [[half-orc]] [[fighter]] named [[Chester Hearth]], who frequented the [[Golden Goblet Inn]] in Mossbridges. They considered the fighter to be a friendly fellow and enjoyed occasional shared drinks.
document_data.History: Rodenostro and Vianten both hailed from the Forest Kingdom of [[Cormyr]]. By the late 14{{th}} century DR, after the war in the Vast ended, both stonecutters moved to the town of Mossbridges to work on its many new building constructions. There, Rodenostro and Vianten became frequent customers of the Golden Goblet Inn, a new and bustling establishment on the town's main street.
